issue.title: Missing Module Implementation
issue.description: The security module __init__.py is completely empty. This is a placeholder module that exists in the directory structure but has no implementation, making it unusable for its intended purpose.
issue.recommendation: Implement the module following the established project pattern: export routers with descriptive aliases (e.g., security_router, audit_router) from subdirectories. See regions/__init__.py for reference.

issue.title: Inconsistent with Project Pattern #68
issue.description: Feature module __init__.py files should export multiple routers with descriptive aliases according to project pattern #68. This file is empty and doesn't follow the established convention.
issue.recommendation: Follow the pattern used in other feature modules: import routers from subdirectories and export them with __all__. Example: from .routers.security import router as security_router

issue.title: No Module Exports
issue.description: The module doesn't export any public API through __all__, making it unclear what should be imported from this module.
issue.recommendation: Define __all__ to specify the public API of the module, exporting the necessary routers, services, or utilities.

issue.title: Missing Module Documentation
issue.description: No module-level docstring to explain the purpose and contents of the security feature module.
issue.recommendation: Add a module docstring at the beginning of the file describing the security module's purpose, such as handling audit logging, rate limiting, and security-related operations.

issue.title: Incomplete Module Structure
issue.description: The security module has subdirectories (audit, models, rate_limiting, repositories, routers, services) but their __init__.py files are also empty, indicating an incomplete implementation.
issue.recommendation: Complete the implementation of subdirectories and ensure proper exports are configured at each level of the module hierarchy.

issue.title: Dead Code Structure
issue.description: The module structure exists but contains no implementation, creating dead code that adds no value but increases codebase complexity.
issue.recommendation: Either implement the security module with its intended functionality or remove it until implementation is ready to avoid maintaining empty placeholder structures.

review.summary: The security module __init__.py file is completely empty (0 lines), serving as a placeholder in the NeoAdminApi feature structure. This module appears to be intended for security-related functionality including audit logging, rate limiting, and security services, but currently lacks any implementation. The file violates project pattern #68 which requires feature module __init__.py files to export routers with descriptive aliases. The empty state makes the module unusable and inconsistent with other implemented feature modules like regions and organizations.

positive_observations.observation: The directory structure is properly organized following the feature module pattern with appropriate subdirectories for audit, models, rate_limiting, repositories, routers, and services.
The file exists in the correct location within the features directory structure.

context.tests: No tests found for the security module.
context.documentation: No documentation exists for the security module functionality.
context.configuration: Module structure exists but is not configured or implemented.
